lead_paragraph: THE fortunes of Kia and Hyundai markedly improved after those Korean companies, now part of the same corporate family, began offering extra-long warranties. In recent weeks, as the incentive wars have escalated, other automakers have beefed up their warranties. To ease concern over the quality of their cars, Kia and Hyundai instituted a bumper-to-bumper warranty of five years or 60,000 miles, whichever comes first, and powertrain coverage for 10 years or 100,000 miles.
abstract: Kia Motors, Hyundai Motor and DaimlerChrysler have beefed up their warranties in recent weeks as incentive wars have escalated (S)
